title: Does Natural Deodorant Really Work? We Tried 50 to Find Out
sub_head: After intense experimenting, here’s what we consider the 10 best natural-deodorant options. Plus: Experts weigh in to debunk common myths about the chemicals people put under their arms.
body:
ON A PARTICULARLY sweltering day this summer, I found myself applying—and reapplying—deodorant. As I swiped and swiped again, it struck me that I had no idea what was in the chalky, drugstore-bought formulas I’ve been diligently smearing on my underarms for over a decade. Yes, the ingredients are usually listed on the applicators—cyclopentasiloxane, dimethicone were printed on the back of a recent stick. But what layperson knows what those are? Or whether they’re good for your delicate sweat glands?
So this fall, after being bombarded by Instagram ads and influencer posts touting natural deodorant, I decided to give it a try. I assumed “natural” indicated simple ingredients that were easy to pronounce. But determining what I should put in my armpits was harder than I thought, and I was skeptical about whether this stuff could keep my underarms dry and odor-free.
